column4: Is there an estimate how long it will be until Breezy is reasonably stable? So that X/Firefox isn't breaking all the time?
you can use an existing *.desktop file as a template
that is the last line in my xfce.desktop file, that I am using as a template
the most important is the execute line
ok, i'll try this, restart X
you rename the *.desktop file to suit, of course
update-rc.d I think is what you mean
you might prefer the "bum" GUI app
start up scripts ( or acyually links to /etc/init.d )
I understand you link the /etc/init.d/whatever file to the /etc/rc?.d file, but what is with the numbers, and letters S and K being in some files? and what is /etc/rcS.d?
do a  ls -l /etc/rcS.d to see the links - S = start k= kill ( on shutdown)
